comment: Would NOT recommend this professor. Never had a professor take off points for going over the an essay page requirement. Seems like professor was purposely trying to find something to knock off points. Don't choose this professor.

I enjoyed the class material but did not enjoy the professor. She says she's a very "strict" grader, I can't even consider it strict. It's ridiculous how quickly you can get a 0. Your grade can change from an A to an F after one assignment. Her class is reliant on quizzes and two big essays. I recommend not taking her class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Grades really harshly on papers. Her class was the only one I didn't do well in.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Extra credit discussion post and short to the point lectures. the exams are not hard, but she has two papers with very specific instructions please pay attention to the details because she is very particular with grading midterm and final papers. the exams are lockdown with webcam, but if you review the learning objectives you should be fine

I took her online class this past semester and it honestly was not that bad. I mean I got an A and I barely read the book. I've definitely had harder classes but this one does have lock down browser and camera. There are 2 papers- one midterm and one final paper (4-6 pages).The discussions each week are optional extra credit
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: save your time, take this course with a different professor.
NEEDS TO BE FIRED. WORST PROFESSOR AT KSU.
tough grader & the only class i didnt make an a in. dont take
Just don't.
decent professor test and discussion heavy.
Don't believe the 5 star reviews, what student actually talks like that? She writes those herself. run. avoid at all cost. If you care about your GPA

The professor is awesome, the homework assignments are manageable even if you have a busy schedule. Professor responded to email swiftly and was available to students. I have taken this Professor before and highly recommend taking her courses.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Very tough grader, I have all A's in my other classes but a C is hers. I would not take her class if you can avoid it
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: run
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Truly a great professor. I finished with a 102 in the class. She cares deeply, you just need to apply yourself. If you ask questions and try, it is an easy A. Some people did not read instructions or follow examples, then you will not do great. If you follow the examples, assignments take less than a hour and are not hard.
Grades incredibly tough. Would not recommend taking her as a professor

Dr. Edwards is very sweet, but if you struggle with procrastinating or writing papers do not take her. Quizzes and tests are open note and are relatively easy, it's the assignments that'll get you. She grades her papers very harshly but gives good feedback to apply to your other papers.

Dr. Edwards is very sweet. She was readily available via email. She provides video lectures for every module. Every week there is a multiple choice quiz. There were a few writing assignments throughout the semester, which were a bit challenging but she gave helpful feedback. She truly cares and constantly checks in via D2L.

Dr. Edwards was incredibly quick, kind, and thorough in her email responses, and I never felt intimidated to reach out. I have never experienced being taught by such a caring professor who is both understanding but passionate about her work. She grades fairly easy and gives wonderful in-depth feedback. She doesn't expect you to be a perfectionist.

This is an entry level course with a SERVICE-LEARNING requirement. No where when I signed up did it state that was a requirement of the course. If you work full time or have classes outside of this course good luck. If I could give a 0 I would. Convinced she wrote all the reviews in here, there is no way she was liked by this many people. TRASH.
Her lectures are very interesting and engaging, her tests match up with the quizzes so this class is easy as long you read the textbook and do the work!

I really enjoyed the class and amazing caring professor , its very straightforward. The quizzes are to attempts which is great the discussion posts are little more time consuming but doable. Great class and I learned a lot , unlike many teachers she makes lecture videos that are really short and easy to follow.

This class isn't too hard. She posts a lecture and other materials each week and a D2L quiz. She also adds a lot of ungraded activities you can do. Her tests are lockdown with webcam. Still read the textbook

Prof. Edwards is really nice and she will frequently remind you with announcements of anything thats due by the end of the week. Weekly quizzes with two chances, 4 exams, discussion post on analyzing cases. Textbook is needed to analyze small details of the cases in the discussions.

Dr. Edwards was absolutely amazing. She gives good lectures and she gives study guides to help with the exams. I really enjoyed the class and look forward to taking her again. As long as you do the assignments on time and in the correct format you will receive a good grades.

She was a good professor very willing to schedule meetings. But as far as the content the book didnt really help me. The quizzes were very easy. But the tests were hard for me. But I would recommend that you study daily so its embedded in your head. exams 50% of your grade. So one bad one can drop you a lot. This class stressed me out honestly.

This is the nicest psych teacher I have ever had. She is so enthusiastic about what she teaches. Only graded on test and a final project. Test are a little hard, study the weekly goals. The final project is an easy A PowerPoint. Only lecture so if you skip you will not have notes. She gives extra credit!!! A whole grade point!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Class was switched to online because of the virus. It is an easy A if that is what you are looking for. However, if you are wanting to actually LEARN and RETAIN information without just memorizing to pass a test, I suggest taking someone else. Class runs like a high school elective class--nowhere near preparing anyone for a Master's program.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: The material can seem daunting but Professor Edwards orients it in a format that makes it all digestible and easy to learn. She offers great feedback and knows how to make sure your discussions are both presentable and professional. Her assignments are never over-the-top and she knows how to make online courses feel as fluid as in-person lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Edwards made this class enjoyable. Although this was an online class and I never met her face to face, I could tell through her feedback that she is very caring towards her students. Tons of extra credit was offered & exams weren't too difficult. Pay attention to weekly deadlines & follow instructions for discussion posts!

I enjoyed this class as a psychology minor. There were online readings and a quiz most every week and a few tests scattered throughout the semester. Every few weeks we would do a Fact/Myth discussion forum, but she lays out clear grading criteria to follow. Overall a very manageable class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took her as a hybrid and still loved her! She gives great examples there is group assignments at the end of class, but they are easy A's. One paper at the end, but it is only 3pages. I would take her again! Lectures are great, and help wit the Quizes and Exams.

I LOVED HER! She's so entertaining and will make sure the class is engaged, you'll notice the first day. We have 1 final paper which is pretty easy, random group assignments at the end of class (easy A), no quizzes, weekly homework assignments, 3-4? Tests which are also pretty easy but you definitely have to study due to how much content there is.

Pretty straightforward & average class. Weekly quizzes, a few discussion posts, & 3 tests. Since this wasnt a lockdown browser class, it was open book open note quizzes/tests. The discussions & class were easy. Solid choice for an online class.
She's amazing. Take this class you won't regret it.

Best professor I have had at KSU!!! I finished with a 99% in this hybrid class! She's a very interesting teacher and always makes sure class is not boring. All quizzes and tests are online and almost every week class assignments are due that you do in groups. She gives a lot of extra credit, which helped raise my grade to a 99%.

Dr. Edwards constantly communicates throughout the semester! We have a discussion post weekly, a weekly quiz, and 3 tests. The quizzes and test information came straight from the material she freely provides. No textbook was needed. The first test was stupid hard but we complained and they got much easier! Highly recommend!!

Dr. Edwards is cool and funny; she likes to interact with students A LOT so if you're shy you might hate that. All her tests are online and they're all easy. You have to write 5 papers as a group, but she's an easy grader with those. Lots of graded in class activities. She's super energetic and passionate about Ed Psych. I'd def take her again.

She does really well at teaching. She gives random in class group work that count to your grade so go to class! She doesnt tell you when she will give them so its best to show up every day to avoid getting a 0. A LOT OF group work. In class & outside class. Theres 5 outside of class group assignments. Great class but I hated all the group work!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--GROUP PROJECTS
